title: High memory computer hardware for metagenomic analysis
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText: The equipment is being used by staff in the University for a range of applications.
findingsText: The purchased equipment has now been installed and is fully functional. It is effectively a computer with impressive quantities of RAM (512Gb per node) and is open to people in the Faculty of Life Sciences and more widely within the University. The basis of the bid was reconstructing genomes from complex metagenomic sequence datasets, however, the equipment is available for other problems which would benefit from this sort of high powered computational facility. The computational facility is available to users in the Faculty of Life Sciences and more widely in manchester. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Digital/Communication/Information Technologies (including Software),Education,Environment
